justification: The article states that “trust is a latent psychological construct, and is typically measured through self-report (Razin & Feigh, 2023).”

measured_by: proportion of compliance with the bot’s recommendation
justification: For Experiment 1 the authors note that “The measure is the proportion of times the participant decides to adopt, or rely on, the bot's recommendation,” using this behavioural proportion as their trust metric.

The paper explains that “Historically, JAS studies have computed the ‘weight of advice’; as an index of trust behaviour (Harvey & Fischer, 1997; Yaniv, 2004),” defining WoA as a continuous measure of how much the participant moves toward the recommendation.
